page.title: 13THE WILDLIFE AROUND FENWICK
page.content: This area is flat{farmland.}There are few woods and many hedgerows have been taken out. Therefore the{animals}have few places to hide. The animals found in this area are, rabbits, hares, pheasants, partridges, voles and all kinds of mice.{Swifts}can be seen near the lake and the remaining wetland. In one dyke there is the only remaning bed of{yellow irises}to be found in the area. The ruined brickworks are turning into a haven for many{wild {flowers}as well as owls and bats in the ruined chimneys. Along the verges of the narrow country roads poppies and ox-eye daisies can still be seen.
